citations.narrative:
The facility failed to maintain housing facilities free of jagged edges or sharp points that might injure the animals.
• In several enclosures, the chain link fence on the ground to prevent digging is exposed. The animals are walking on top
of the chain link.
• In the McFluffin and Zoey enclosure, there is a rack of PVC pipe that is nailed to a wooden board. Several of the PCV
pipes are chewed and broken exposing sharp points. The wood on the doghouse is shredded and splintered with rough,
sharp edges. There is a square piece of metal laying on the ground with sharp edges exposed.
• In the U1 Drogo and Gamora enclosure, there is a sharp metal point sticking into the enclosure where they place their
food bowls. There is also chain link fence exposed on the ground that they walk on.
Failure to maintain housing facilities in good repair can lead to injury of the animals contained in them. Exposed chain link
fence on the ground and broken and torn enclosure may also have rough or sharp edges which can lead to injury of the
animal.
Housing facilities shall be free of jagged edges or sharp points that might cause injury to the animal. To be corrected by
December 6, 2025.

The facility failed to maintain all surfaces on a regular basis. There are two plastic igloo shaped doghouses in two
separate enclosures that are severely chewed and cannot be cleaned or sanitized. They are dirty on the outside and
grossly gnawed and torn at the entrance.
Surfaces of housing facilities including houses, dens, and objects withing the facility that cannot be readily cleaned and
sanitized must be replaced when worn or soiled. To be corrected by December 6, 2025.

The licensee had fecal tests performed by the attending veterinarian, but the results of the tests are not documented in
writing on a medical record. Failure to document the results of the testing may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials
to determine if the dogs are receiving adequate veterinary care.
Medical records must include the results of all screening, routine, or other required or recommended tests or
examinations. The licensee must document the results of all fecal testing and ensure that all medical records are
complete and contain all the required information. To be corrected by December 6, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
